member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ProvideBindingPathAttribute
member.summary:
This attribute registers a path that should be probed for candidate assemblies at assembly load time.
For example: [...\VisualStudio\10.0\BindingPaths\{5C48C732-5C7F-40f0-87A7-05C4F15BC8C3}] "$PackageFolder$"=""
This would register the "PackageFolder" (i.e. the location of the pkgdef file) as a directory to be probed for assemblies to load.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.ProvideBindingPathAttribute.SubPath
member.summary: An optional SubPath to set after $PackageFolder$. This should be used if the assemblies to be probed reside in a different directory than the pkgdef file.

member.name: M:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputClassifier.GetClassificationSpans(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan)
member.param: The span of interest in this projection buffer.
member.returns: The list of as contributed by the source buffers.

member.name: E:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputClassifier.ClassificationChanged
member.summary: Ocurs when the classification of a span of text has changed.
member.remarks: This event does not need to be raised for newly-inserted text. However, it should be raised if any text other than that which was actually inserted has been reclassified. It should also be raised if the deletion of text causes the remaining text to be reclassified.

member.name: M:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputClassifierProvider.GetClassifier(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.ITextBuffer)
member.summary: Gets the classifier for specified text buffer.

member.name: M:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.BuildOutputClassifier.GetClassificationSpans(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan)
member.summary: Classify the given spans, which, for diff files, classifies a line at a time.
member.param: The span of interest in this projection buffer.
member.returns: The list of as contributed by the source buffers.

member.name: E:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.BuildOutputClassifier.ClassificationChanged
member.summary: Ocurs when the classification of a span of text has changed.
member.remarks: This event does not need to be raised for newly-inserted text. However, it should be raised if any text other than that which was actually inserted has been reclassified. It should also be raised if the deletion of text causes the remaining text to be reclassified.

member.name: T:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputColorerInstallerPackage
member.summary:
This is the class that implements the package exposed by this assembly.
The minimum requirement for a class to be considered a valid package for Visual Studio is to implement the IVsPackage interface and register itself with the shell. This package uses the helper classes defined inside the Managed Package Framework (MPF) to do it: it derives from the Package class that provides the implementation of the IVsPackage interface and uses the registration attributes defined in the framework to register itself and its components with the shell.

member.name: M:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputColorerInstallerPackage.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor of the package. Inside this method you can place any initialization code that does not require any Visual Studio service because at this point the package object is created but not sited yet inside Visual Studio environment. The place to do all the other initialization is the Initialize method.

member.name: M:Talk2Bits.OutputColorer.OutputColorerInstallerPackage.Initialize
member.summary: Initialization of the package; this method is called right after the package is sited, so this is the place where you can put all the initilaization code that rely on services provided by VisualStudio.
